newsitem.title: USA: Apple calls report of layoffs speculation.
newsitem.headline: Apple calls report of layoffs speculation.

text.p: An Apple Computer Inc spokeswoman on Monday labeled as speculation a report the struggling computer company would lay off 40 percent of its workforce when it announces a restructuring in late March.

A report published on MSNBC's World Wide Web site cited "a well-placed Apple executive" as telling MSNBC that Apple would cut 4,400 of its 11,000 full-time employees and take a charge for severance benefits of $300 to $350 million.
"Those numbers are based on speculation, because we have not determined what the final numbers will be," Apple spokeswoman Katie Cotton said.

Early this month, Apple unveiled a plan to consolidate is marketing and development units into fewer groups to cut costs and concentrate on key computer market. But specifics of the plan -- such as layoffs and possible charges -- would not be announced until March, Apple said.
MSNBC is a joint venture between Microsoft Corp and General Electric Co's NBC television network.
The venture broadcasts news on a cable television channel and over the Internet.
